title: Ernie Hines - Electrified [1972]
description:
Ernie Hines - Electrified [1972]

Original Release / We Produce Records / XPS-1902 / CD

An underground set from early 70s Stax Records Ã¢â‚¬â€œ the only set cut back in the day by Ernie Hines Ã¢â‚¬â€œ a really great singer who works here with a blend of southern soul and sweet harmony modes! The album's got a pretty laidback vibe, which is great Ã¢â‚¬â€œ almost in the same space as The Temprees, with an undercurrent of super-dope arrangements, and Ernie's lead vocals right up front in the mix! There's a bit of strings on the set, and most tracks have some sort of harmony support behind Hines' lead Ã¢â‚¬â€œ a vibe that's a bit different, and maybe almost more east coast than the usual Stax set. Arrangements are by Wardell Quezquerque, Dale Warren, Lester Snell, and Tom Nixon Ã¢â‚¬â€œ and both The Bar Kays and The MGs play on the record. Titles include the sample classic "Our Generation" Ã¢â‚¬â€œ plus "Electrified Love", "Sugar Plum", "Change Is Gonna Come", "Your Love (Is All I Need)", and "Come On Y'All".
